abstracts.cdata!:
The second additional financing (SF2) of
            the Fourth Development Support Credit of Bangladesh will
            help Government of Bangladesh (GOB) continue along the path
            of reforms needed to accelerate economic growth and poverty
            reduction. The SF2 credit will help GOB meet the immediate
            short-term needs by reducing the fiscal pressure on the FY08
            budget arising from unforeseen cyclone-related spending,
            including the need to provide large amounts of cash and food
            aid (including rice) to address the consumption needs of the
            affected population. GOB has already redirected some of its
            budgetary resources for cyclone rescue and relief.
            Concessionary financing from development partners in support
            of the additional resource requirement would be critical in
            this hour of need.
